abstract: John McCallum, Canadian Immigration minister, announces plans to admit total of 55,800 political refugees into Canada in 2016, many of whom are from Syria.

headline.print_headline: The Americas; Canada: Government Raises Its Target for Admitting Political Refugees
headline.main: Canada: Government Raises Its Target for Admitting Political Refugees

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The government said Tuesday that Canada would bring in a total of 55,800 political refugees this year, many of them fleeing the Syrian civil war.
lead_paragraph: The government said Tuesday that Canada would bring in a total of 55,800 political refugees this year, many of them fleeing the Syrian civil war.
